newsitem.title: SOUTH KOREA: PRESS DIGEST - S.Korean newspapers - Oct 22.
newsitem.headline: PRESS DIGEST - S.Korean newspapers - Oct 22.

text.p: The following is a summary of major South Korean political stories in leading newspapers, prepared by Reuters in Seoul. Reuters has not checked the stories and does not gaurantee their accuracy. Telephone: (822) 727-5650. Fax: (822) 727-5666.

- President Kim demands apology from N. Korea for intrusion of armed guerrillas using sub last month; government to put top priority on price stability next year, Kim says in his budget message to National Assembly.

- Ex-president Roh's daughter probed in connection with bribery and promotion scandal involving former Defense Minister Lee Yang-ho; Lee expected to be summoned this week for prosecution on bribery charge and leak of military secrets.

- A Korean-American arms dealer who disclosed former defense minister Lee's bribery case flew to Seoul from Los Angeles Oct 17, left Seoul for Beijing after an overnight stay, eluding indictment; In Beijing he claims he has tape recorded how Daewoo Heavy Industries Co. offered to give 2 billion won in return for defense contract involving light combat helicopters.

- President Kim Young-sam replaced Defense Minister Lee Yang-ho with General Kim Dong-jin, chairman of the Joint Chiefs of Staff. Kim made the appointment out of apparrent displeasure with the military's failure to detect a North Korean submarine which sneaked into South Korean waters on September 18.
- New tax-free savings system attracts 200 billion won in the first day the new saving product goes into force Monday.
- Daewoo Heavy Industries gave 1.3 billion won to former defense minister in connection with helicopter defense contract, Korean-American arms dealer claims in Beijing.
- U.S. rejects N. Korea's bid for a high-level meeting, allowing only a working-level contact with N. Korea's American bureau director-general Lee now visiting Washington.
- Prosecution probes bank accounts of ex-defense chief Lee; former president Roh's daughter faced query.
- Japan's hashimoto vows to stay on in new coalition government.
- Kim, Carlos hold summit talks, agree on need for Seoul and Madrid to boost two-day business ventures.
